name: src/.eslintrc.js
src/add-script.js
addScript
description:
Adds an script from the given src to the page.

WARNING: This is incredibly dangerous. Only use this if you are sure
you can trust the given src.

params.name: document
params.description: The document object.

params.name: src
params.description: The src of the script to be added.

return.description: A promise that resolves when the script finishes loading.

name: inline
description:
Adds an script with the given content to the page.

WARNING: This is incredibly dangerous. Only use this if you know
exactly what you're doing, and if the content is a hardcoded string,
and definitely nothing that comes from user input.

The given content starts executing immediately. This function returns
immediately unless the given content code hangs or throws (in which
case this function will also hang/throw respectively).

params.name: document
params.description: The document object.

params.name: content
params.description: The content to be put in the script.

name: src/array-has.js
arrayHas
description:
Checks whether the given array contains the given value(s) or not. The value(s) is/are
searched in O(n*k) using javascript strict equality operator (`===`), where n is the
array length and k is the amount of passed values.

This function returs true if and only if all given values are present in the array.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} A boolean that indicates whether the array contains the value.

params.name: array
params.description: The array to be checked

params.name: values
params.description: The value(s) to be searched in the array

return.description: A boolean that indicates whether the array contains the value.

name: src/array-to-map.js
arrayToMap
description:
Creates an ES6 Map object from an array, where each object's key is defined
by the keyMaker function.

unknown.tagValue:
{Map} A map whose keys are the results of calling keyMaker on the array
elements and whose values are the array elements.

params.name: array
params.description: The source array.

params.name: keyMaker
params.description:
The function that takes an element of the array and
returns a key to be used in the map for that element. If this function returns
a repeated key for two different objects, the former will be overwritten and
only the latter value will remain in the map.

return.description:
A map whose keys are the results of calling keyMaker on the array
elements and whose values are the array elements.

name: src/array-to-picker-function.js
arrayToPickerFunction
description:
Creates a function that yields the elements of the given array in order when called with
different arguments (and is idempotent). If the end of the array is reached, picking will
restart from the beginning. The behaviour of this function is better understood by example
(which can be found below).

params.name: array
params.description: The source array

return.description: The picker function

name: src/base64-substitution-cipher.js
base64SubstitutionCipher
description:
Perform a substitution cipher on any string by first converting the string to Base64. Note: this is a very weak
encryption algorithm that shouldn't be used for security purposes.

The plaintext alphabet used is "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/=" (after the
string is converted to Base64).

To decrypt, set the `reverse` option to true.

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be encrypted / decrypted.

params.name: options
params.description: An object to provide options.

params.name: options.ciphertextAlphabet
params.description: The ciphertext alphabet to be used. Must be an anagram of the plaintext alphabet.

params.name: options.reverse
params.description:
Whether or not to reverse the encryption, i.e., to decrypt. Setting this
to true will cause the cipher to be undone followed by the Base64 decode of the result.

throws.description: If the `reverse` option is set to true and the passed string is not a valid Base64 string.

name: src/browser-secure-random.js
browserSecureRandom
description: Cryptographycally secure equivalent to Math.random() in browsers.

return.description: A number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive)

name: src/call-sequentially.js
callSequentially
description:
Takes an array of functions and calls them sequentially. If any of these
functions return a promise, the promise is waited for, before calling the next
functions.

params.name: functions
params.description: The array of functions to be called sequentially

return.description:
A promise that resolves when the last call is done and
rejects with an error if any of the functions throw an error (in which case
the sequence is terminated immediately).

name: src/colorize-console.js
colorizeConsole
description:
Colorizes `console.warn` and `console.error` and adds the extra methods
`console.blue`, `console.green` and `console.gray`.

name: src/count-occurrences.js
countOccurrences
description: Counts how many times each element of the array occurs in it.
examples:
```
let array = ["a", 1, null, "b", null, "b", "a", "a"];
let countMap = countOccurrences(array);
countMap.get("a"); // 3
countMap.get(1); // 1
countMap.get(null); // 2
countMap.get("b"); // 2
```

return.description: A map that maps elements to the amount of occurrences.

name: src/deduplicate-by.js
deduplicateBy
description:
Produces an array which contains a subset of the given array, deduplicating
elements by the values each yield when passed to the valuePicker function.
In other words, produces a subset of the array by keeping only one element
per value yielded when passed to the valuePicker function.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} The resulting array (if inPlace is true, this is the same as
the passed array, otherwise it is a new array).

params.name: array
params.description: The array to the deduplicated

params.name: valuePicker
params.description:
A function that when applied to each value of
the array returns another value to be used for the deduplication. This function
is called only once per value.

params.name: inPlace
params.description:
If true, alters the given array instead of
creating a new one.

return.description:
The resulting array (if inPlace is true, this is the same as
the passed array, otherwise it is a new array).

name: src/deep-clone.js
deepClone
description:
Deep clone an object without circular references. Everything whose typeof is
not "object" will be copied by reference (without cloning).

params.name: object
params.description: The object to be cloned

return.description: The cloned object

throws.description: If the object has circular references

name: src/download-file.js
downloadFile
description: Downloads a file from a given URL and saves it.

params.name: sourceURL
params.description: The URL containing the file to be downloaded.

params.name: destinationFilePath
params.description:
The path (including filename) for
the file to be saved. If omitted, defaults to the same filename given in
the sourceURL.

return.description:
A promise that resolves when everything is done or reject
with any error that happens in the process.

name: src/ellipsis.js
ellipsis
description: Shorten a string to a certain length (truncating it and adding "...").
examples:
```
ellipsis("Hello World!", 11); // "Hello Wo..."
ellipsis("Hello", 8); // "Hello"
ellipsis("Hello World", 11); // "Hello World"
```

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be shortened

params.name: length
params.description: The desired length (including the "...")

return.description: A string whose length is at most the given length.

name: src/exec-async.js
execAsync
description:
Executes a system command and returns a promise for its stdout output.
Output to stderr is ignored.

params.name: command
params.description: The command to execute

return.description:
A promise for the output. Rejects if the command
exits with nonzero code.

name: src/filter-in-place.js
filterInPlace
description: Filter an array in-place.

params.name: filterFunction
params.description: The filter function.

return.description: Returns the same array.

name: src/get-now-string.js
getNowString
description:
Get a string representation of the current moment.

The string follows the pattern of the following example: 2018-07-22_20h04min29s

name: src/lorem-ipsum.js
loremIpsum
description: Generate a random string of words, lorem-ipsum style.

params.name: wordCount
params.description: The amount of words to generate.

params.name: fullstop
params.description:
Whether or not to add a
full stop (".") in the end of the string.

params.name: ucfirst
params.description:
Whether or not the first
character is uppercase.

return.description: The generated string.

name: src/make-private-accessor.js
makePrivateAccessor
description:
Generates an accessor function to get/set pseudo-private fields on objects. This function,
when passed an object, returns another object which is its pseudo-private field keeper. This
is better understood with an example.

name: src/map-in-place.js
mapInPlace
description: Map an array in-place.

params.name: mapFunction
params.description: The map function.

return.description: Returns the same array.

name: src/map-object.js
mapObject
description:
Create a new object with the same keys as the given object, whose values
on those keys are mapped by the mapFunction function. This should be analogous
to the usage of Array.prototype.map, but for objects.

params.name: obj
params.description: The source object

params.name: mapFunction
params.description: The map function

return.description: The new object

name: src/node-secure-random.js
nodeSecureRandom
description: Cryptographycally secure equivalent to Math.random() in Node.

return.description: A number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive)

name: src/open-native-file-select-dialog.js
openNativeFileSelectDialog
description:
Open the native file select dialog, exaclty as
when a user clicks on a <input type='file' />.

return.description:
A promise that resolves with the
selected file(s).

name: src/overlays.js
overlays
description: A collection of methods to work with overlays.

name: src/pick-random-subset.js
pickRandomSubset
description: Pick a random subset array of the given array.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array whose elements consist of a random subset of the given array.

params.name: array
params.description: The source array.

params.name: options
params.description: An object specifying options.

params.name: options.length
params.description:
If specified, defines the length of the subset to be taken.
If omitted (undefined), the length of the subset will be defined randomly between
options.minLength and array.length (inclusive)

params.name: options.minLength
params.description:
This option is only relevant if options.length is
undefined. This option defines the minimum length of the picked subset. A common use case
is to set this option to 1 instead of the default 0 to disallow the empty subset to be
taken.

return.description: An array whose elements consist of a random subset of the given array.

throws.description: If options.length or options.minLength is greater than array.length.

name: src/pick-random.js
pickRandom
description:
Pick a random element from the given array (using a uniform distribution
produced by `Math.random()`).

unknown.tagValue: {*} A random element from the given array.

params.name: array
params.description: The array.

return.description: A random element from the given array.

name: src/random-int.js
randomInt
description: Generates an int between begin (inclusive) and end (exclusive).
examples:
```
randomInt(0, 5); // A value between 0 and 4 (inclusive)
randomInt(-3, 1); // A value between -3 and 0 (inclusive)
```

params.name: begin
params.description: The begin of the range (inclusive)

params.name: end
params.description: The end of the range (exclusive)

return.description:
An int whose value is between begin (inclusive) and
end (exclusive).

name: src/read-console.js
readConsole
description: Reads user input from the console, optionally typing a message first.

params.name: message
params.description: An optional message to prompt the user

return.description: A promise with the typed answer

name: src/replace-array.js
replaceArray
description: Replaces an array with another array (in-place).

params.name: baseArray
params.description: The array that will be replaced by the other array.

params.name: otherArray
params.description:
The array whose values will be put into the base array.
This array is not modified by calling this function.

return.description: Returns the base array (for chaining convenience).

name: src/sanitize-html-in-text.js
sanitizeHTMLInText
description:
Replaces all occurrences of '&', '<', '>', '"' and "'" in text
with their 'safe' counterparts (such as '&').

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be sanitized

return.description: The sanitized text

name: src/sha-256.js
sha256
description:
Generates the SHA-256 hash of the given string.

(c) Chris Veness 2002-2014 / MIT License
Modified by Pedro Augusto de Paula Barbosa (2018) - MIT

See http://csrc.nist.gov/groups/ST/toolkit/secure_hashing.html
and http://csrc.nist.gov/groups/ST/toolkit/examples.html

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be hashed

return.description:
The hash of the string, which is a string of
length 64 and made of only hexadecimal symbols (0-9 and a-f).

name: src/shallow-clone.js
shallowClone
description: Returns a shallow clone of the given object.

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to be shallow-cloned

return.description: The shallow-cloned object

name: src/shuffle-array.js
shuffleArray
description:
Shuffles the given array in-place, using the Fisher-Yates algorithm (also known
as Knuth algorithm).

Recall that if you want a new array instead of changing the existing array, just
call .slice() before.

params.name: array
params.description: The array to be shuffled.

return.description: The same array (for chaining convenience).

name: src/simple-substitution-cipher.js
simpleSubstitutionCipher
description:
Perform a simple substitution cipher on a string. Note: this is a very weak encryption algorithm that shouldn't
be used for security purposes.

It is common to associate this function with Base64 encode/decode methods so that any string can be encrypted,
instead of only working with strings whose chars are in the plaintext alphabet. The default plaintext and
ciphertext alphabets are compatible with Base64. See, for example. js-base64 by dankogai on npm.

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be encrypted.

params.name: options
params.description: An object to provide options.

params.name: options.plaintextAlphabet
params.description: The plaintext alphabet to be used. Must have the same length as options.ciphertextAlphabet.

params.name: options.ciphertextAlphabet
params.description: The ciphertext alphabet to be used. Must have the same length as options.plaintextAlphabet.

params.name: options.reverse
params.description:
Whether or not to reverse the encryption. Setting this to true is exactly
equivalent as switching options.plaintextAlphabet and options.ciphertextAlphabet.

params.name: options.unknownChar
params.description:
The character to be used in place of a character in the input string that
is not present in the plaintext alphabet. If null, the character will be left untouched.

name: src/sort-by.js
sortBy
description: Sort the given array in-place using the values returned by the valuePicker.

params.name: array
params.description: The array to be sorted.

params.name: valuePicker
params.description:
A function that when applied to each value of
the array returns another value to be used for the sorting. This function is
called only once per value.

params.name: reverse
params.description: Whether or not to reverse the sorting.

return.description: The given array (for chaining convenience).

name: src/to-diacritics-insensitive-regex.js
toDiacriticsInsensitiveRegex
description: Converts a given string to a regex that matches it in a diacritic-insensitive way.

params.name: string
params.description: The string to be matched

return.description: The regexp that matches the string in a diacritic-insensitive way

name: src/unzip.js
unzip
description: Unzips a given zip file into the destination folder.

params.name: zipFilePath
params.description:
The path to the zip file, as an
absolute path or a relative path to the given cwd (current
working directory).

params.name: destFolter
params.description:
The destination folder, into
which the unzipped files will be put, as an absolute path or
a relative path to the given cwd (current working directory).
Will be created if it does not exist.

params.name: cwd
params.description:
The reference path to be used for
internally computing the absolute paths of the first two
parameters. This parameter itself can be given as an absolute
path or a relative path to `process.cwd()`.

return.description:
A promise that resolves when the unzipping is
complete as rejects if any error happens in the process.

name: src/wait.js
wait
description: Get a promise that resolves after a given amount of milliseconds.

params.name: millis
params.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait before resolving the promise.

params.name: value
params.description: A value to fulfill the promise with.

return.description:
A promise that resolves after the given amount of milliseconds with
the given value (if given) or undefined (if not given).

name: src/zero-pad-left.js
zeroPadLeft
description:
Convert the given value to string, adding zeros to the left of it
so that the resulting string has length equal to the given length
(or, if the number representation is longer than the given length,
simply return the number converted to string).

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be converted (usually a number)

params.name: length
params.description: The desired length

return.description:
A string representation of the value with
length greater than or equal to the given length.
